symptoms.name: Scabby lesions
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Usually on lips, mouth, gums, palate, tongue, teats, legs; can spread to other body parts

symptoms.name: Vesicular lesions
symptoms.pattern: Prominently appearing in the lips and mouth of affected animals

symptoms.name: Papular lesions
symptoms.pattern: Prominently appearing in the lips and mouth of affected animals

symptoms.name: Nodular lesions
symptoms.pattern: Prominently appearing in the lips and mouth of affected animals

symptoms.name: Pustules
symptoms.pattern: Flat-topped, blood-tinged; may leak fluid before crusting

symptoms.name: Blisters
symptoms.pattern: May be solitary or few in number, most commonly on fingers, hands, or forearms; can appear on the face

symptoms.name: Enlarged lymph glands (lymphadenopathy)
symptoms.pattern: Inner side of elbow and/or under the arm

symptoms.name: Weight loss
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be significant in young lambs

symptoms.name: Debilitation
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be significant in young lambs

symptoms.name: Secondary bacterial infection
symptoms.pattern: Can lead to prolonged disease or death

symptoms.name: Erythema multiforme
symptoms.pattern: Secondary rash; target-like macules, plaques, and blisters on hands and feet, face, arms, and legs; may develop 10–14 days after onset of orf

required: Clinical history of handling sheep or goats
